cards.title: How it's made / Pink cricket balls for world's first day-night test
cards.rawTitle: Pink cricket balls for world's first day-night test

item.title: How it's made: Pink cricket balls for world's first day-night test
item.trailText: Pink cricket balls being produced at the Kookaburra factory in Melbourne
item.standFirst: Pink cricket balls being produced at the Kookaburra factory in Melbourne. The pink balls will be used in the world's first day-night Test match which will be played in Adelaide from 27 Nov-1 Dec between Australia and New Zealand. Cricket Australia announced the new format as an attempt to revive test match attendance and television ratings

cards.title: Football / Sampaoli: 'Now the dream begins' following win over Peru
cards.rawTitle: Sampaoli: 'Now the dream begins' following win over Peru

item.title: Chile's Jorge Sampaoli: 'Now the dream begins', following 2-1 win against Peru
item.trailText: Chile coach Jorge Sampoli and Peru's coach Ricardo Garceca comment on their teams' Copa América quarter-final match on Monday night
item.standFirst: Chile coach Jorge Sampoli and Peru's coach Ricardo Garceca comment on their teams' Copa América quarter-final match on Monday night. Chile beat Peru 2-1 and will now qualify for the semi-final of the Copa América tournament. Peru's Gareca says he is not satisfied with the loss, but adds that he is happy that his team did their best

cards.title: Football / USA and Germany ready for Women's semi-final in Montreal
cards.rawTitle: USA and Germany ready for Women's semi-final in Montreal

item.title: USA and Germany ready for Women's World Cup 2015 semi-final in Montreal
item.trailText: Speaking on Monday, USA manager Jill Ellis and forward Alex Morgan look ahead to their team's World Cup clash against Germany on Tuesday at Montreal's Olympic Stadium
item.standFirst: Speaking on Monday, USA manager Jill Ellis and forward Alex Morgan look ahead to their team's World Cup clash against Germany on Tuesday at Montreal's Olympic Stadium. Ellis says the team are excited to be in the semi-finals while Morgan says the match is comparable with a final. Germany's manager Silvia Neid also looks ahead to the match, saying her side will be braver and more robust than in previous matches

cards.title: Kauto Star / The story of the greatest steeplechaser in the modern era
cards.rawTitle: The story of the greatest steeplechaser in the modern era

item.title: Kauto Star: a life in pictures
item.trailText: The story of the greatest steeplechaser in the modern era, the winner of 23 races, including a record five King George Chases
item.standFirst: The story of the greatest steeplechaser in the modern era, the winner of 23 races, including a record five King George Chases, who has died after a fall

displayImages.caption: Kauto Star in his box at Paul Nicholls’ stables at Ditcheat in Somerset Photograph: Tom Jenkins/the Guardian
displayImages.altText: Kauto Star in his box at Paul Nicholls’ stables in Somerset
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kauto Star in his box at Paul Nicholls’ stables at Ditcheat in Somerset

displayImages.caption: Mick Fitzgerald is on board as Kauto Star jumps the last fence in the Tingle Creek Chase, his first Grade One success at Sandown in 2005 Photograph: John Gichigi/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Mick Fitzgerald is on board as Kauto Star jumps the last fence in the Tingle Creek Chase, his first Grade One success at Sandown in 2005
displayImages.cleanCaption: Mick Fitzgerald is on board as Kauto Star jumps the last fence in the Tingle Creek Chase, his first Grade One success at Sandown in 2005

displayImages.caption: Kauto Star announces himself as a Gold Cup candidate with victory in the Betfair Chase at Haydock in November 2006 Photograph: Dave Kendall/PA Photos
displayImages.altText: Kauto Star announces himself as a Gold Cup candidate with victory in the Betfair Chase at Haydock in November 2006
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kauto Star announces himself as a Gold Cup candidate with victory in the Betfair Chase at Haydock in November 2006

displayImages.caption: Ruby Walsh can afford to take a leisurely look behind as his mount easily wins the Tingle Creek Chase for the second year running Photograph: Julian Herbert/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Ruby Walsh can afford to take a leisurely look behind as his mount easily wins the Tingle Creek Chase for the second year running
displayImages.cleanCaption: Ruby Walsh can afford to take a leisurely look behind as his mount easily wins the Tingle Creek Chase for the second year running

displayImages.caption: Kauto Star blundered through the final fence, something which was to become a dreaded habit, but still landed the first of his King George victories at Kempton in December, 2006 Photograph: Julian Herbert/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Kauto Star blundered through the final fence, something which was to become a dreaded habit, but still landed the first of his King George victories at Kempton in December, 2006
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kauto Star blundered through the final fence, something which was to become a dreaded habit, but still landed the first of his King George victories at Kempton in December, 2006

displayImages.caption: Ruby Walsh was able to celebrate in style after Kauto Star posted a perfect six from six for the season when winning the Cheltenham Gold Cup in March 2007 Photograph: Ryan Pierse/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Ruby Walsh was able to celebrate in style after Kauto Star posted a perfect six from six for the season when winning the Cheltenham Gold Cup in March 2007
displayImages.cleanCaption: Ruby Walsh was able to celebrate in style after Kauto Star posted a perfect six from six for the season when winning the Cheltenham Gold Cup in March 2007

displayImages.caption: Following a shock defeat at Aintree on his reappearance, Kauto Star was ridden by Sam Thomas to land the Betfair Chase Race at Haydock in November 2007 Photograph: Julian Herbert/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Following a shock defeat at Aintree on his reappearance, Kauto Star was ridden by Sam Thomas to land the Betfair Chase Race at Haydock in November 2007
displayImages.cleanCaption: Following a shock defeat at Aintree on his reappearance, Kauto Star was ridden by Sam Thomas to land the Betfair Chase Race at Haydock in November 2007

displayImages.caption: Kauto Star bounced back to his brilliant best when pulling away from the last fence to win the King George VI Chase by 11 lengths in 2007 Photograph: Julian Herbert/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Kauto Star bounced back to his brilliant best when pulling away from the last fence to win the King George VI Chase by 11 lengths in 2007
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kauto Star bounced back to his brilliant best when pulling away from the last fence to win the King George VI Chase by 11 lengths in 2007

displayImages.caption: Kauto Star had unseated Sam Thomas in the 2007 Betfair Chase, but is pictured here in the unsaddling enclosure after winning the King George VI Chase a month later for the third time running Photograph: Tom Jenkins/the Guardian
displayImages.altText: Kauto Star had unseated Sam Thomas in the 2007 Betfair Chase, but is pictured here in the unsaddling enclosure after winning the King George VI Chase a month later for the third time running
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kauto Star had unseated Sam Thomas in the 2007 Betfair Chase, but is pictured here in the unsaddling enclosure after winning the King George VI Chase a month later for the third time running

displayImages.caption: Ruby Walsh sits up in the saddle on Kauto Star as the jockey celebrates the great horse’s victory in the 2009 Cheltenham Gold Cup Photograph: Tom Jenkins/the Guardian
displayImages.altText: Ruby Walsh sits up in the saddle on Kauto Star as the jockey celebrates the great horse’s victory in the 2009 Cheltenham Gold Cup
displayImages.cleanCaption: Ruby Walsh sits up in the saddle on Kauto Star as the jockey celebrates the great horse’s victory in the 2009 Cheltenham Gold Cup

cards.title: Football / Čech says that he is excited to join Arsenal from Chelsea
cards.rawTitle: Čech says that he is excited to join Arsenal from Chelsea

item.title: Petr Čech excited to join Arsenal from Chelsea
item.trailText: Newly-signed Arsenal goalkeeper Petr Čech says he feels he has made a good choice in joining Arsenal after moving from Chelsea
item.standFirst: Newly-signed Arsenal goalkeeper Petr Čech says he feels he has made a good choice in joining Arsenal after moving from Chelsea. Čech says Arsène Wenger has assured him that Arsenal will offer him the opportunities and challenges he wants in the Premier League and in Europe. He also comments on the difficulty of leaving Chelsea

cards.title: Rugby union / South Africa will use Championship as World Cup test
cards.rawTitle: South Africa will use Championship as World Cup test

item.title: South Africa will use Championship as World Cup test
item.trailText: Meyer: South Africa will use Championship as World Cup test - video
item.standFirst: The Springboks train on Monday in Johannesburg ahead of their World XV in Cape Town on 11 July before flying to Australia to start the Rugby Championship. The team are looking at a tight schedule of competitive matches and warm-ups before their first game against Japan on 19 September
